name: The Grease Spell (vs Knockdown feat) and Finger of Death: random thoughts during a Druid playthrough...
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
A good Druid Grease Spell makes Knockdown feat look really weak...

Anyway I thought I'd share this thought playing through the Druid class during a Solo play through of World of Greyhawk PW. This particularly thought is not going to be news to the uber Druid players out there, and certainly not for Maximillan Kane, if he is still out there..., having read some of his famous posts... (http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 16635.html)

I'm playing through World of Greyhawk Persistent World. Taking on one of the tougher areas, Critwall. Which I was advised not to go to unless I enjoyed running or taking a dirt nap. What the heck I want a challenge. Lets go.

I break the Critwall Siege and go one area west. Solo Druid 17/Monk 1, with Knockdown / Spell Focus: Conjuration / Greater Spell Focus Conjuration.

I'm fighting two tough Bugbear Warriors. I cast Grease, turn into elemental shape. Fight in the Grease like a carnival mudpit. Or a Wild Pig in Mud. Happy times!

They simply cannot stand up to fight me for the whole duration of the spell!!! (7 rounds) No need to try to knockdown them down.. what's the mechanics here?
Spoiler Maybe add +4 (Dex 18) for high reflex save types and +2 (Dex 14) for low reflex save types. Probably too generous here for the other types. -> Reflex class save 16 Non reflex class save 8 vs DC 27

I think I have found my new favourite spell... I honestly thought as a shapechanger I would have to use the Knockdown feat .... no sir cast grease instead... Well if I run out of spells or shape changes I guess it might be useful...



Finger of Death looks very strong...

Ok I'm working through this enemy outpost just to the southeast of the area I described. I whittle the enemy down one by one. But at the end there is this big bad Ogre Mage, who I struggle to defeat despite my efforts. His name is Satchamo.

I cast all sorts of spells. Empowered Ice Storm. Storm of Vengance. Summon Creature 8. Call lightning. etc etc... Doesn't touch him.
I try to hit him with my strongest forms. Monk bear and Monk Water Elemental tickle him. 
Run away, rack my brain for a solution.
Lets try Finger of Death. I wait for his Death Ward buff to wear off (by returning to the area later). He dies instantly. 
Happy days... the mechanics of it all?
SpoilerFinger of Death (Druid) DC: 10 + 8 (spell level) + 12 (wis modifier) = 30. Probable saving throw for high fortitude save Lvl 20 enemies: 12 (base) + 4 (assume Cons 18) = 16 95% chance of death for non-high fortitude save enemies at Lvl 20
Seems super strong...



Anyway hope you enjoyed this post!
